name: Sphinx of Secrets
lore: A sphinx of secrets is a formidable guardian of forbidden knowledge, dwelling in ancient temples and hidden vaults. Those who seek the sphinx's wisdom must prove their worth through riddles and tests of intellect or face destruction. The sphinx's leonine body and humanlike face radiate an aura of inscrutable power, and its mere presence warps time and space within its lair.

traits.name: Inscrutable
traits.description: The sphinx can't be targeted by Divination spells or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance
traits.description: If the sphinx fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The sphinx has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiattack.description: The sphinx makes two Arcane Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Arcane Claw
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Force damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The sphinx casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attack rolls).

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: The sphinx makes one Arcane Claw attack.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.description: The sphinx teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

lair.description: A sphinx of secrets lairs in a temple, tomb, or ruin, typically in a desert or on another plane of existence. The lair is filled with ancient texts, magical wards, and inscrutable puzzles that test the minds of any who dare enter.

actions.name: Time Warp
actions.description: The sphinx targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) Psychic damage and have the Incapacitated condition until initiative count 20 on the next round.

savingThrow.targets: one creature the sphinx can see within 120 feet

conditions.duration: until initiative count 20 on the next round

actions.name: Psychic Onslaught
actions.description: Each creature within a 60-foot Emanation originating from the sphinx must succeed on a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw or take 13 (3d8) Psychic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage only.

savingThrow.targets: each creature within a 60-foot Emanation originating from the sphinx

regionalEffects.description: Divination spells cast within the region by creatures other than the sphinx have a 25 percent chance of providing misleading results instead of accurate information. The sphinx is aware when such a spell is cast within the region.
regionalEffects.endCondition: The effect ends when the sphinx dies or moves its lair.

regionalEffects.description: The region within the lair is suffused with an aura of hidden knowledge. Creatures other than the sphinx have Disadvantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks to find hidden doors and traps.
regionalEffects.endCondition: The effect ends when the sphinx dies or moves its lair.
